text: During the 1931–32 season Foot-Ball Club Juventus competed in Serie A and the Mitropa Cup. ==Summary== The club transferred new players in to the roster such as Enzo Rosa and Brazilian Pietro Sernagiotto (who had an agreement with Genova). Juventus clinched its second title in a row with 54 points one more from the previous campaign surpassing runner-up Bologna thanks to a powerful offense scoring 89 goals (65 in away) and conceded only 38.
